results.title: Fish and their characteristics
results.brief_description: Underwater photography introduces the characteristics of fish and shows how this group of vertebrates is fitted for its environment. Illustrates the variety of form, protective devices and reproductive methods in different types of fish. Distinguishes true fish from other marine animals and studies the freshwater perch as a representative fish.

results.title: First year A.D.
results.creator_credit: Karl Holtsnider and Franciscan Communication Center
results.brief_description: An asthmatic child is hospitalized, bringing together his estranged parents, whose obvious hostility toward each other intrudes upon their real concern for their child. They finally lose control and quarrel in his presence as he is about to leave the hospital. The boy has another serious attack, but with the help of a sympathetic nurse, the parents realise they must stop battling for their child’s love.

results.title: The First World Karate-Do Championship tournament
results.brief_description: Footage of the “First world karate-do Championships Tournament”, including opening ceremony and demonstrations. Presumably held in Japan, c. 1960. Competing countries include: Thailand, Indonesia, States of Brunei, USA, Great Britain, Korea, Canada, Chile, Hon Kong, Israel, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, and many others. 1st, 2nd and 3rd places won by Japan.

results.title: First steps
results.creator_credit: Alec MacLeod, Philip Bridgeman, Colin Low, Stanley Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Overview of a Canadian program called “First steps” which is designed to provide extra stimulation and structured learning situations for children who are born with intellectual retardation. Suitable for tertiary levels. (Awards: Vancouver; Columbus; Salerno).

results.title: The First priority
results.creator_credit: Joe O'Brien, Ray Davey, National Educational Television and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A comprehensive summary of the world food problem indicating why it is such a crucial problem today. Shows how the FAO is already coping with the problem and how the campaign is aimed at showing people all over the world what can be done. Gives examples of action projects aimed at long term solutions.

results.title: First of all, water
results.creator_credit: Ake Backlund, AB Nordisk Filmkopia and Radio Sweden
results.brief_description: The film aims to draw attention to the possibilities available for detecting and reaching subsoil water. Swedish scientists have made a great contribution as regards getting hold of, quickly and at reasonable cost, life-giving, pure water.

results.title: The First motion picture show
results.brief_description: Excellent combination of artwork, old still photos, and animation illustrates the successive stages leading to the first successful public motion-picture demonstration in 1880. Traces the technological development of the three essential components of the motion picture: projection, animation and photography.

results.title: The First mile up
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film on air pollution, with surprising disclosures of what the seemingly empty air around us holds. The film noses around the atmosphere that encloses our Earth - the comparatively thin envelope of air on which all life depends. The problem is discussed by engineers, health authorities and scientists, including Nobel-prize-winning chemist Dr. Linus Pauling.
